intro: Phaca cryptantha, commonly known as the cryptantha phaca, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, a feature typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Phaca cryptantha thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
